name: Ext.chart.series.Area
doc:
Creates an Area Chart.

Ext.create({
   xtype: 'cartesian', 
   renderTo: document.body,
   width: 600,
   height: 400,
   insetPadding: 40,
   store: {
       fields: ['name', 'data1', 'data2', 'data3'],
       data: [{
           name: 'metric one',
           data1: 10,
           data2: 12,
           data3: 14
       }, {
           name: 'metric two',
           data1: 7,
           data2: 8,
           data3: 16
       }, {
           name: 'metric three',
           data1: 5,
           data2: 2,
           data3: 14
       }, {
           name: 'metric four',
           data1: 2,
           data2: 14,
           data3: 6
       }, {
           name: 'metric five',
           data1: 27,
           data2: 38,
           data3: 36
       }]
   },
   axes: [{
       type: 'numeric',
       position: 'left',
       fields: ['data1'],
       grid: true,
       minimum: 0
   }, {
       type: 'category',
       position: 'bottom',
       fields: ['name']
   }],
   series: {
       type: 'area',
       subStyle: {
           fill: ['#0A3F50', '#30BDA7', '#96D4C6']
       },
       xField: 'name',
       yField: ['data1', 'data2', 'data3']
   }
});

members.name: animation
members.doc: The series animation configuration. By default, the series is using the same animation the chart uses, if it's own animation is not explicitly configured.

members.name: background
members.doc: Sets the background of the surface the series is attached.

members.name: chart
members.doc: The chart that the series is bound.

members.name: colors
members.doc: An array of color values which is used, in order of appearance, by the series. Each series can request one or more colors from the array. Radar, Scatter or Line charts require just one color each. Candlestick and OHLC require two (1 for drops + 1 for rises). Pie charts and Stacked charts (like Bar or Pie charts) require one color for each data category they represent, so one color for each slice of a Pie chart or each segment (not bar) of a Bar chart. It overrides the colors that are provided by the current theme.
members.short_doc: An array of color values which is used, in order of appearance, by the series. ...

members.name: fullStack
members.doc: If true, the height of a stacked bar is always the full height of the chart, with individual components viewed as shares of the whole determined by the fullStackTotal config.
members.short_doc:
If true, the height of a stacked bar is always the full height of the chart,
with individual components viewed as sha...

members.name: fullStackTotal
members.doc: If the fullStack config is set to true, this will determine the absolute total value of each stack.
members.short_doc:
If the fullStack config is set to true, this will determine
the absolute total value of each stack. ...

members.name: highlight
members.doc: The sprite attributes that will be applied to the highlighted items in the series. If set to 'true', the default highlight style from highlightCfg will be used. If the value of this config is an object, it will be merged with the highlightCfg. In case merging of 'highlight' and 'highlightCfg' configs in not the desired behavior, provide the 'highlightCfg' instead.
members.short_doc: The sprite attributes that will be applied to the highlighted items in the series. ...

members.name: highlightCfg
members.doc: The default style for the highlighted item. Used when highlight config was simply set to 'true' instead of specifying a style.
members.short_doc: The default style for the highlighted item. ...

members.name: itemInstancing
members.doc: The sprite template used to create sprite instances in the series.

properties.name: display
properties.doc:
Specifies the presence and position of the labels. The possible values depend on the series type. For Line and Scatter series: 'under' | 'over' | 'rotate'. For Bar and 3D Bar series: 'insideStart' | 'insideEnd' | 'outside'. For Pie series: 'inside' | 'outside' | 'rotate' | 'horizontal' | 'vertical'. Area, Radar and Candlestick series don't support labels. For Area and Radar series please consider using tooltips instead. 3D Pie series currently always display labels 'outside'. For all series: 'none' hides the labels.

Default value: 'none'.

properties.name: color
properties.doc:
The color of the label text.

Default value: '#000' (black).

properties.name: field
properties.doc:
The name(s) of the field(s) to be displayed in the labels. If your chart has 3 series that correspond to the fields 'a', 'b', and 'c' of your model, and you only want to display labels for the series 'c', you must still provide an array [null, null, 'c'].

Default value: null.

properties.name: font
properties.doc:
The font used for the labels.

Default value: '14px Helvetica'.

properties.name: orientation
properties.doc:
Either 'horizontal' or 'vertical'. If not set (default), the orientation is inferred from the value of the flipXY property of the series.

Default value: ''.

properties.name: renderer
properties.doc:
Optional function for formatting the label into a displayable value.

The arguments to the method are:

  • text, sprite, config, rendererData, index

    Label's renderer is passed the same arguments as renderer plus one extra 'text' argument which comes first.

return.name: return
return.doc:
The attributes that have been changed or added, or the text for the label. Example to enclose every other label in parentheses:

 renderer: function (text) {
     if (index % 2 == 0) {
         return '(' + text + ')'
     }
 }

members.name: labelOverflowPadding
members.doc: Extra distance value for which the labelOverflow listener is triggered.

members.name: marker
members.doc:
The sprite template used by marker instances on the series. If the value of the marker config is set to true or the type of the sprite instance is not specified, the Ext.draw.sprite.Circle sprite will be used.

Examples:

marker: true

marker: {
    radius: 8
}

marker: {
    type: 'arrow',
    animation: {
        duration: 200,
        easing: 'backOut'
    }
}
members.short_doc: The sprite template used by marker instances on the series. ...

members.name: markerSubStyle
members.doc: This is cyclic used if series have multiple marker sprites.

members.name: overlaySurface
members.doc: The surface used to render series labels.

members.name: renderer
members.doc: Area series renderers only affect markers. For styling individual segments with a renderer it is possible to use the Line series with Ext.chart.series.Line.fill config set to true, which makes Line series look like Area series.

params.name: sprite
params.doc: The sprite affected by the renderer. The visual attributes are in sprite.attr. The data field is available in sprite.getField().

params.name: config
params.doc: The sprite configuration, which varies with the series and the type of sprite. For instance, a Line chart sprite might have just the x and y properties while a Bar chart sprite also has width and height. A type might be present too. For instance to draw each marker and each segment of a Line chart, the renderer is called with the config.type set to either marker or line.

params.name: rendererData
params.doc: A record with different properties depending on the type of chart. The only guaranteed property is rendererData.store, the store used by the series. In some cases, a store may not exist: for instance a Gauge chart may read its value directly from its configuration; in this case rendererData.store is null and the value is available in rendererData.value.

params.name: index
params.doc: The index of the sprite. It is usually the index of the store record associated with the sprite, in which case the record can be obtained with store.getData().items[index]. If the chart is not associated with a store, the index represents the index of the sprite within the series. For instance a Gauge chart may have as many sprites as there are sectors in the background of the gauge, plus one for the needle.

return.name: return
return.doc:
The attributes that have been changed or added. Note: it is usually possible to add or modify the attributes directly into the config parameter and not return anything, but returning an object with only those attributes that have been changed may allow for optimizations in the rendering of some series. Example to draw every other marker in red:

 renderer: function (sprite, config, rendererData, index) {
     if (config.type === 'marker') {
         return { strokeStyle: (index % 2 === 0 ? 'red' : 'black') };
     }
 }

@controllable

members.short_doc: Area series renderers only affect markers. ...

members.name: showInLegend
members.doc: Whether to show this series in the legend.
members.short_doc: Whether to show this series in the legend. ...

members.name: showMarkers
members.doc: Whether markers should be displayed at the data points along the line. If true, then the marker config item will determine the markers' styling.
members.short_doc: Whether markers should be displayed at the data points along the line. ...

members.name: splitStacks
members.doc: true to stack negative/positive values in respective y-axis directions.
members.short_doc: true to stack negative/positive values in respective y-axis directions. ...

members.name: stacked
members.doc: true to display the series in its stacked configuration.
members.short_doc: true to display the series in its stacked configuration. ...

members.name: store
members.doc: The store to use for this series. If not specified, the series will use the chart's store.
members.short_doc: The store to use for this series. ...

members.name: style
members.doc: Custom style configuration for the sprite used in the series. It overrides the style that is provided by the current theme.
members.short_doc: Custom style configuration for the sprite used in the series. ...

members.name: subStyle
members.doc: This is the cyclic used if the series has multiple sprites.
members.short_doc: This is the cyclic used if the series has multiple sprites. ...

members.name: surface
members.doc: The chart surface used to render series sprites.

members.name: themeStyle
members.doc: Style configuration that is provided by the current theme. It is composed of five objects:

properties.name: style
properties.doc: Properties common to all the series, for instance the 'lineWidth'.

properties.name: subStyle
properties.doc: Cyclic used if the series has multiple sprites.

properties.name: label
properties.doc: Sprite config for the labels, for instance the font and color.

properties.name: marker
properties.doc: Sprite config for the markers, for instance the size and stroke color.

properties.name: markerSubStyle
properties.doc: Cyclic used if series have multiple marker sprites.

members.short_doc: Style configuration that is provided by the current theme. ...

members.name: title
members.doc: The human-readable name of the series (displayed in the legend). If the series is stacked (has multiple components in it) this should be an array, where each string corresponds to a stacked component.
members.short_doc: The human-readable name of the series (displayed in the legend). ...

members.name: tooltip
members.doc:
Add tooltips to the visualization's markers. The config options for the tooltip are the same configuration used with Ext.tip.ToolTip plus a renderer config option and a scope for the renderer. For example:

tooltip: {
  trackMouse: true,
  width: 140,
  height: 28,
  renderer: function (toolTip, record, ctx) {
      toolTip.setHtml(record.get('name') + ': ' + record.get('data1') + ' views');
  }
}

Note that tooltips are shown for series markers and won't work if the marker is not configured.

You can also configure Ext.chart.interactions.ItemHighlight.multiTooltips to display multiple tooltips for adjacent or overlapping Line series data points within Ext.chart.series.Line.selectionTolerance radius.

properties.name: scope
properties.doc: The scope to use when the renderer function is called. Defaults to the Series instance.

properties.name: renderer
properties.doc: An 'interceptor' method which can be used to modify the tooltip attributes before it is shown. The renderer function is passed the following params:

properties.name: toolTip
properties.doc: The tooltip instance

properties.name: record
properties.doc: The record instance for the chart item (sprite) currently targeted by the tooltip.

properties.name: ctx
properties.doc: A data object with values relating to the currently targeted chart sprite

properties.name: category
properties.doc: The type of sprite passed to the renderer function (will be "items", "markers", or "labels" depending on the target sprite of the tooltip)

properties.name: field
properties.doc: The yField for the series

properties.name: index
properties.doc: The target sprite's index within the series' items

properties.name: record
properties.doc: The record instance for the chart item (sprite) currently targeted by the tooltip.

properties.name: series
properties.doc: The series instance containing the tooltip's target sprite

properties.name: sprite
properties.doc: The sprite (item) target of the tooltip

members.short_doc: Add tooltips to the visualization's markers. ...

members.name: useDarkerStrokeColor
members.doc: Colors for the series can be set directly through the 'colors' config, or indirectly with the current theme or the 'colors' config that is set onto the chart. These colors are used as "fill color". Set this config to true, if you want a darker color for the strokes. Set it to false if you want to use the same color as the fill color. Alternatively, you can set it to a number between 0 and 1 to control how much darker the strokes should be. Note: this should be initial config and cannot be changed later on.
members.short_doc:
Colors for the series can be set directly through the 'colors' config, or indirectly
with the current theme or the 'c...

members.name: xAxis
members.doc: xAxis The chart axis the series is bound to in the 'X' direction. Normally, this would be set automatically by the series. For charts with multiple x-axes, this defines which x-axis is used by the series. It refers to either axis' ID or the (zero-based) index of the axis in the chart's axes config.
members.short_doc: xAxis The chart axis the series is bound to in the 'X' direction. ...

members.name: xField
members.doc: The field used to access the x axis value from the items from the data source.

members.name: yAxis
members.doc: yAxis The chart axis the series is bound to in the 'Y' direction. Normally, this would be set automatically by the series. For charts with multiple y-axes, this defines which y-axis is used by the series. It refers to either axis' ID or the (zero-based) index of the axis in the chart's axes config.
members.short_doc: yAxis The chart axis the series is bound to in the 'Y' direction. ...

members.name: yField
members.doc: The field(s) used to access the y-axis value(s) of the items from the data source.

members.name: dataRange
members.doc:
The range of "coordinated" data. Typically, for two directions ('X' and 'Y') the dataRange would look like this:

dataRange[0] - minX
dataRange[1] - minY
dataRange[2] - maxX
dataRange[3] - maxY

And the series' coordinate method would be called like this:

coordinate('X', 0, 2)
coordinate('Y', 1, 2)

For numbers, coordinated data are numbers themselves. For categories - their indexes. For Date objects - their timestamps. In other words, whatever source data we have, it has to be converted to numbers before it can be plotted.

members.name: fieldCategoryX
members.doc:
Tells which store record fields should be used for a specific axis direction. E.g. for

fieldCategory<direction>: ['<fieldConfig1>', '<fieldConfig2>', ...]

the field names from the following configs will be used:

series.<fieldConfig1>Field, series.<fieldConfig2>Field, ...

See Ext.chart.series.StackedCartesian.getFields.
members.short_doc: Tells which store record fields should be used for a specific axis direction. ...

members.name: isStoreDependantColorCount
members.doc: Series, where the number of sprites (an so unique colors they require) depends on the number of records in the store should set this to 'true'.
members.short_doc:
Series, where the number of sprites (an so unique colors they require)
depends on the number of records in the store ...

members.name: reversedSpriteZOrder
members.doc: If true, each subsequent sprite has a lower zIndex so that the stroke of previous sprite in the stack is not covered by the next sprite (which makes the very top segment look odd in flat bar and area series, especially when wide strokes are used).
members.short_doc:
If true, each subsequent sprite has a lower zIndex so that the stroke of previous
sprite in the stack is not covered ...

members.name: type
members.doc: The type of series. Set in subclasses.

members.name: addItemHighlight
members.doc: Adds the 'itemhighlight' interaction to the chart that owns the series.
members.short_doc: Adds the 'itemhighlight' interaction to the chart that owns the series. ...

members.name: coordinateData
members.doc: This method will return an array containing data coordinated by a specific axis.

params.name: field
params.doc: The field to fetch from each record.

params.name: axis
params.doc: The axis used to lay out the data.

members.short_doc: This method will return an array containing data coordinated by a specific axis. ...

members.name: findMatchingAxis
members.doc: Given the list of axes in a certain direction and a list of series fields in that direction returns the first matching axis for the series in that direction, or undefined if a match wasn't found.
members.short_doc:
Given the list of axes in a certain direction and a list of series fields in that
direction returns the first matchin...

members.name: getFields
members.doc:
Each series has configs that tell which store record fields to use as data for a certain dimension. For example, xField, yField for most cartesian series, angleField, radiusField for polar series, openField, ..., closeField for CandleStick series, etc. The field category is an array of capitalized config names, minus the 'Field' part, to use as data for a certain dimension. For example, for CandleStick series we have:

fieldCategoryY: ['Open', 'High', 'Low', 'Close']

While for generic Cartesian series it is simply:

fieldCategoryY: ['Y']

This method fetches the values of those configs, i.e. the actual record fields to use.

The coordinate method in turn will use the values from the fieldCategory array to set data attributes of the series sprite. E.g., in case of CandleStick series, the following attributes will be set based on the values in the fieldCategoryY array:

`dataOpen`, `dataHigh`, `dataLow`, `dataClose`

Where the value of each attribute is a coordinated array of data from the corresponding field.
members.short_doc:
Each series has configs that tell which store record fields to use as data
for a certain dimension. ...

members.name: getItemByIndex
members.doc: Returns a series item by index and (optional) category.

params.name: index
params.doc: The index of the item (matches store record index).

members.short_doc: Returns a series item by index and (optional) category. ...

members.name: getItemForPoint
members.doc: For a given x/y point relative to the main rect, find a corresponding item from this series, if any.

return.name: return
return.doc: An object describing the item, or null if there is no matching item. The exact contents of this object will vary by series type, but should always contain at least the following:

properties.name: record
properties.doc: the record of the item.

properties.name: point
properties.doc: the x/y coordinates relative to the chart box of a single point for this data item, which can be used as e.g. a tooltip anchor point.

properties.name: sprite
properties.doc: the item's rendering Sprite.

properties.name: subSprite
properties.doc: the index if sprite is an instancing sprite.

members.short_doc:
For a given x/y point relative to the main rect, find a corresponding item from this
series, if any. ...

members.name: getSprite
members.doc: Returns the first sprite. Convenience method for series that have a single markerholder sprite.

members.name: getSprites
members.doc: Returns the read-only array of sprites the are used to draw this series.
members.short_doc: Returns the read-only array of sprites the are used to draw this series. ...

properties.name: style
properties.doc: Properties common to all the series, for instance the 'lineWidth'.

properties.name: subStyle
properties.doc: Cyclic used if the series has multiple sprites.

properties.name: label
properties.doc: Sprite config for the labels, for instance the font and color.

properties.name: marker
properties.doc: Sprite config for the markers, for instance the size and stroke color.

properties.name: markerSubStyle
properties.doc: Cyclic used if series have multiple marker sprites.

properties.name: scope
properties.doc: The scope to use when the renderer function is called. Defaults to the Series instance.

properties.name: renderer
properties.doc: An 'interceptor' method which can be used to modify the tooltip attributes before it is shown. The renderer function is passed the following params:

properties.name: toolTip
properties.doc: The tooltip instance

properties.name: record
properties.doc: The record instance for the chart item (sprite) currently targeted by the tooltip.

properties.name: ctx
properties.doc: A data object with values relating to the currently targeted chart sprite

properties.name: category
properties.doc: The type of sprite passed to the renderer function (will be "items", "markers", or "labels" depending on the target sprite of the tooltip)

properties.name: field
properties.doc: The yField for the series

properties.name: index
properties.doc: The target sprite's index within the series' items

properties.name: record
properties.doc: The record instance for the chart item (sprite) currently targeted by the tooltip.

properties.name: series
properties.doc: The series instance containing the tooltip's target sprite

properties.name: sprite
properties.doc: The sprite (item) target of the tooltip

members.name: processData
members.doc:
Data processing overview.

The data is processed in the following order:

1) chart.processData() - calls processData of all series 2) series.processData() - calls processData of all bound axes, or jumps to (5) directly, if the series has no axis in this direction 3) axis.processData() - calls the processData of its own layout 4) axisLayout.processData() - calls coordinateX/Y of all bound series 5) series.coordinateX/Y - calls its own coordinate method in that direction 6) series.coordinate - calls its own coordinateData method using the right record fields and axes 7) series.coordinateData - calls getCoordFor of the axis layout for the given field 8) layout.getCoordFor - returns a numeric value for the given field value, whatever its type may be

The dataX, dataY attributes of the series' sprites are set by the series.coordinate method using the data returned by the coordinateData. series.coordinate also calculates the range of said data (via expandRange) and sets the dataMinX/Y, dataMaxX/Y attributes of the series' sprites.

members.name: provideLegendInfo
members.short_doc: Provide legend information to target array. ...

return.name: return
return.doc:
The attributes that have been changed or added. Note: it is usually possible to add or modify the attributes directly into the config parameter and not return anything, but returning an object with only those attributes that have been changed may allow for optimizations in the rendering of some series. Example to draw every other marker in red:

 renderer: function (sprite, config, rendererData, index) {
     if (config.type === 'marker') {
         return { strokeStyle: (index % 2 === 0 ? 'red' : 'black') };
     }
 }

members.name: themeColorCount
members.doc: Returns the number of colors this series needs. A Pie chart needs one color per slice while a Stacked Bar chart needs one per segment. An OHLC chart needs 2 colors (one for drops, one for rises), and most other charts need just a single color.
members.short_doc: Returns the number of colors this series needs. ...

members.name: themeMarkerCount
members.doc: Returns the number of markers this series needs. Currently, only the Line, Scatter and Radar series use markers - and they need just one each.
members.short_doc: Returns the number of markers this series needs. ...

members.name: updateChartColors
members.doc: When the chart's "colors" config changes, these colors are passed onto the series where they are used with the same priority as theme colors, i.e. they do not override the series' "colors" config, nor the series' "style" config, but they do override the colors from the theme's "seriesThemes" config.
members.short_doc:
When the chart's "colors" config changes, these colors are passed onto the series
where they are used with the same p...

members.name: updateLegendStore
members.doc: Updates chart's legend store when the value of the series' hidden config changes or when the setHiddenByIndex method is called.

params.name: hidden
params.doc: Whether series (or its component) should be hidden or not.

params.name: index
params.doc: Used for stacked series. If present, only the component with the specified index will change visibility.

members.short_doc:
Updates chart's legend store when the value of the series' hidden config
changes or when the setHiddenByIndex method ...
